abstract.p: MindShare North America names Andie Fox managing director of its new Atlanta office; CCG.XM names Ellen Steinlauf managing director and Thurston Yates creative services director, new posts, at its New York office; Young & Rubicam Advertising names Austin McGhie, San Francisco office chief executive, to added post as head of new Y&R Branding unit (M)

block.p: * Andie Fox was named managing director at a new Atlanta office of MindShare North America, the media services joint venture of two units of the WPP Group, Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide and J. Walter Thompson. She had been senior partner and media director at the Thompson Atlanta office. * Ellen Steinlauf was named to the new post of managing director and Thurston Yates was named to the new post of director for creative services, both at the New York office of CCG.XM, the global e-business unit of the Cordiant Communications Group. Ms. Steinlauf had been chief operating officer at the New York office of Computer Technology Associates and Mr. Yates had been creative director at Zentropy Partners, New York, part of Interpublic's McCann-Erickson World Group. * Austin McGhie, chief executive at the San Francisco office of Young & Rubicam Advertising, part of the WPP Group, was named to the additional duties of heading Y.& R. Branding, a new autonomous unit.

THE MEDIA BUSINESS: ADVERTISING -- ADDENDA Correction: November 6, 2000, Monday An entry in the Addenda listing with the Advertising column last Monday about two executives who were named to posts at CCG.XM, the global e-business unit of the Cordiant Communications Group, misstated the former post of Thurston Yates, director for creative services. He had been associate creative director, not creative director, at the New York office of Zentropy Partners.
